As for me:

**Pros:**

-Indie Game (these are always fun)

-True Orbital Physics

-Loads of explosive failures

-Success is extremely satisfying

-Awesome community ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

-Mods (a must have for any game)

-Completely free to do whatever you can possibly think up (DISCLAIMER: Few of your ideas will actually work)

I could go on but its legitimately 1:00 AM right now...

**Cons:**

-Kearth is a bit laggy at the moment

-Have to wait about a month between updates... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I feel this list should be sufficient...

Time flies with the help of the community\'s modded parts, though.

Pros:

-Free! (up to .13)

-Cheap! (.14 and above)

-Creative freedom

-Stupidly easy to make MODs

-Constantly getting better due to the hard work of the amazing team

Cons:

-Bit of a system hog at times

-No dual monitor support (would love to see orbital view implemented this way)

-No other planets... yet!

I try not to focus on any cons, as since the game is in development, any cons I might dwell on tend to evaporate. They can also build expectations that Squad have no intention on fulfilling, therefore tarnishing my view of the game. Yes, the new texture mapping leads to a bit of extra lag, but it isn\'t a gamebreaker by a long shot. True, some things haven\'t been implemented yet that were mentioned in passing by Harvester. So what? People have sold games with less work put into them and done quite well.

As a wise person once said, it is better to appreciate what you have, than to want what you don\'t have. Right now I have a game I paid ten dollars for, with the opportunity to enjoy many months of updates to yet to come. Looked at another way, you already got the full KSP now, but with many months of DLC yet to come that you don\'t have to pay for. You just don\'t find that very often around these parts.
